Detailed Description

Base class for reading and writing PDB coordinate files.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

PDBBase::PDBBase ( const std::string  filename,
const verbose_level_t  verbosity = VERBOSE_SILENT 
)

Read in a PDB file.

After a successful call to this constructor, the heavy atoms will be accessible by the CoordFile::begin()/end() functions.

Parameters:
filename Path to the PDB file to read (heavy atoms)
verbosity Whether to send some comments to stdout or not

A number of pdb files do not have HET entries for 1 or more of the HET groups

Parameters:

bool PDBBase::get_res_info ( const std::string  atom_name,
const std::string  res_name,
atom_t *  atom 
) [private]

Given an atom string an residue string, load the Van Der Waals radius, residue enum, atom enum and atom orbit into the given atom structure.

Parameters:
atom_name 4 char atom string
res_name 3 char residue string
atom Pointer to an atom structure return True if the given residue and atom strings are in table, else false

bool PDBBase::is_hydrogen ( const std::string  name  )  [static]

True if the pdb atom name is a hydrogen atom, else false.

Caution: you can't just test column 14 or you will remove metals like Rh, Cd, Pd, Nd, Gd, Md...

Parameters:
name The 4 columns used to specify the ATOM/HETATM name
Returns:
True if is hydrogen, else false

bool PDBBase::read_data ( std::ifstream &  fin,
const bool  ignore_altLocs 
) [protected]

Parameters:
fin Reference to an input pdb file stream
ignore_altLocs If true, use only the first atomic position for each group of alternate locations
Returns:
True if no error occured during reading, else false

Write the atoms to file in PDB format.

Parameters:

Returns:
True if file could be opened for writing, else false

Implements ASCbase::CoordFile.

const std::vector< std::string > &  waters

Write as xyzr lines (coordinates + radius).
